paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data for asymptomatic carriers.

patients.demographics: median age 49 years, interquartile range 37–58, 10 carriers with V30M mutation

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Twenty-three carriers were included with a median age of 49 years.
Twenty-three carriers were included with a median age of 49 years.
Twenty-three carriers were included with a median age of 49 years.

functional_data.summary: Electrophysiological parameters remain stable in asymptomatic carriers.

variants.segregation_data: Does not segregate with disease in families as all carriers were asymptomatic.
variants.additional_notes: The study focused on asymptomatic carriers and did not report any symptomatic cases.
key_quotes: It is imperative to screen asymptomatic carriers of transthyretin (TTR) mutations to initiate treatment early.
Nerve conduction parameters remain relatively stable in asymptomatic TTR carriers.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding TTR variants and penetrance were extracted.
